alert.note: Alert for Albany (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:34PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT FOR EASTERN ALBANY...NORTHWESTERN LARAMIE AND SOUTHWESTERN PLATTE COUNTIES... At 234 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Iron Mountain, or 26 miles northeast of Laramie, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 37 and 40. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
